body_html:
you are holding on to intermediate states of the vgg graph over each forward. if you want to get the output of vgg and store it, you need to do:

import torch
import torch.nn as nn
import torchvision.models as models
from torch.autograd import Variable

vgg19 = models.vgg19(pretrained=True)

l = []
for i in range(10):
l.append(vgg19(Variable(torch.randn([1,3,224,224]))).data)

you are holding on to intermediate states of the vgg graph over each forward. if you want to get the output of vgg and store it, you need to do:

body:
you are holding on to intermediate states of the vgg graph over each forward. if you want to get the output of vgg and store it, you need to do:

```python
import torch
import torch.nn as nn
import torchvision.models as models
from torch.autograd import Variable

vgg19 = models.vgg19(pretrained=True)

l = []
for i in range(10):
l.append(vgg19(Variable(torch.randn([1,3,224,224]))).data)
```
